name: itinerant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
travelling from one place to another, usually to work for a short period: an itinerant journalist/labourer/preacher
More examplesFewer examplesThe preacher had a small flock of itinerant oil workers.The farmers rely on itinerant labour.For a time, my sister was an itinerant church singer.Many fruitpickers were itinerant, following the seasons from farm to farm. This is an indication of how itinerant the US workforce has become.

More examplesFewer examplesShe was an itinerant who had been riding the rails. For much of his life he has been an itinerant, working blue-collar jobs at warehouses and garages.They are itinerants, tinkers and traders.
